intro: Janusia prolixa, commonly known as the slender rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Juncaceae. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems that are often reddish in color and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, arranged in a dense, compact cluster at the base. Janusia prolixa is often found in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds.
